taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Inhabits tide pools and river mouths.  Is frequently encountered in places where small brooks fall into the sea and may occasionally be found in purely fresh water.  During low tide it stays under stones on the dry bottom (Ref. 2058).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Description
dataObjects.title: 描述
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: The Fish Database of Taiwan, available from http://fishdb.sinica.edu.tw
dataObjects.description: 陳等(2012)認為此種魚的分類仍有爭議，暫時以竿鰕虎(Luciogobius sp.)為名。( 林沛立編寫 2013/01)

agents.full_name: 台灣魚類資料庫(The Fish Database of Taiwan)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Northwest Pacific:  China, Korean Peninsula, Japan (Ref. 559) and Hong Kong (Ref. 31075).  Also reported from Peter the Great Bay (Ref. 2058, 26334) and the Kuril Islands (Ref. 37812).
dataObjects.references: Masuda, H., K. Amaoka, C. Araga, T. Uyeno and T. Yoshino 1984 The fishes of the Japanese Archipelago. Vol. 1. Tokai University Press, Tokyo, Japan. 437 p. (text). (Ref. 559)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: demersal; amphidromous (Ref. 51243); freshwater; brackish; marine; depth range 1 - ? m
dataObjects.references: Riede, K. 2004 Global register of migratory species - from global to regional scales. Final Report of the R&D-Projekt 808 05 081. Federal Agency for Nature Conservation, Bonn, Germany. 329 p. (Ref. 51243)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Migration
dataObjects.description: Amphidromous. Refers to fishes that regularly migrate between freshwater and the sea (in both directions), but not for the purpose of breeding, as in anadromous and catadromous species. Sub-division of diadromous.  Migrations should be cyclical and predictable and cover more than 100 km.Characteristic elements in amphidromy are: reproduction in fresh water, passage to sea by newly hatched larvae, a period of feeding and growing at sea usually a few months long, return to fresh water of well-grown juveniles, a further period of feeding and growing in fresh water, followed by reproduction there (Ref. 82692).
